intro: Rhexia trichotoma, commonly known as the hairy leaf rosebay, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. Its botanical features include opposite leaves and capsule fruits that release seeds when mature. Rhexia trichotoma thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
